Sure, I can help you identify the "Disease" entities in the paragraph. Here are the entities mentioned in the paragraph:

1. Endografine (diatrizoate) - This is a contrast agent used in hysterosalpingography (HSG) to visualize the uterus and fallopian tubes.
2. Vasurix polyvidone (acetrizoate) - This is another contrast agent used in HSG to visualize the uterus and fallopian tubes.
3. Dimer-X (iocarmate) - This is a contrast agent used in HSG to visualize the uterus and fallopian tubes.
4. Hexabrix (ioxaglate) - This is a contrast agent used in HSG to visualize the uterus and fallopian tubes.

So, the "Disease" entities in the paragraph are:

1. Hysterosalpingography (HSG) - This is the medical procedure in which the contrast agents are used to visualize the uterus and fallopian tubes.
